thread.title: U.S. Industrial Production Unexpectedly Edges Down 0.1% In November
thread.title_full: U.S. Industrial Production Unexpectedly Edges Down 0.1% In November

author: RTTNews
title: U.S. Industrial Production Unexpectedly Edges Down 0.1% In November
text:
U.S. Industrial Production Unexpectedly Edges Down 0.1% In November
RTTNews | 5h 7min ago
(RTTNews) - The Federal Reserve released a report on Tuesday unexpectedly showing a modest decrease by U.S. industrial production in the month of November.
The report said industrial production edged down by 0.1 percent in November after falling by a revised 0.4 percent in October.
Economists had expected industrial production to rise by 0.3 percent compared to the 0.3 percent dip originally reported for the previous month.
The unexpected decrease by industrial production came as notable declines by mining and utilities output more than offset an uptick by manufacturing output.
read more
[U.S. Retail Sales Climb More Than Expected In November](/news/us-retail-sales-climb-more-than-expected-in-november/32030)
Retail sales in the U.S. increased by more than expected in the month of November, according to a report released by the Commerce Department on Tuesday, with auto sales once again leading the way higher.

[New York Manufacturing Index Pulls Back More Than Expected In December](/news/new-york-manufacturing-index-pulls-back-more-than-expected-in-december/31970)
After reporting a sharp increase by its reading on regional manufacturing activity in the previous month, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York released a report on Monday showing a sharp pullback by the index in the month of December.

[U.S. Import Prices Unexpectedly Edge Higher In November](/news/us-import-prices-unexpectedly-edge-higher-in-november/31911)
Import prices in the U.S. unexpectedly edged higher in the month of November, according to a report released by the Labor Department on Friday. The Labor Department said import prices crept up by 0.1 percent in November, matching the downwardly revised uptick in October. Economists had expected import prices to dip by 0.2 percent.
RTTNews | 4 days ago
[U.S. Import Prices Unexpectedly Inch Up 0.1% In November](/news/us-import-prices-unexpectedly-inch-up-01-in-november/31910)
Import prices in the U.S. unexpectedly edged higher in the month of November, according to a report released by the Labor Department on Friday.
RTTNews | 4 days ago
[U.S. Producer Price Growth Exceeds Estimates In November](/news/us-producer-price-growth-exceeds-estimates-in-november/31862)
A report released by the Labor Department on Thursday showed producer prices in the U.S. increased by more than expected in the month of November. The Labor Department said its producer price index for final demand climbed by 0.4 percent in November after rising by an upwardly revised 0.3 percent in October. Economists had expected producer prices to inch up by 0.2 percent.
RTTNews | 5 days ago
[U.S. Weekly Jobless Claims Unexpectedly Extend Rebound](/news/us-weekly-jobless-claims-unexpectedly-extend-rebound/31861)
First-time claims for U.S. unemployment benefits unexpectedly increased in the week ended December 7th, according to a report released by the Labor Department on Thursday. The report said initial jobless claims climbed to 242,000, an increase of 17,000 from the previous week's revised level of 225,000. Economists had expected jobless claims to dip to 220,000.
